Text: In sociology and social psychology, an ingroup is a social group to which a person psychologically identifies as being a member.
Triplets:<In sociology and social psychology

Text: Ingroups and outgroups:  By contrast, an outgroup is a social group with which an individual does not identify.

Text: Ingroups and outgroups:  It has been found that the psychological membership of social groups and categories is associated with a wide variety of phenomena.
